meanings.definition: a person or thing that preserves something
meanings.sent1: My grandma is a great preserver of family traditions.
meanings.sent2: The preserver of ancient artifacts carefully stored the valuable items.
meanings.sent3: The preserver of memories, my old photo album, always brings a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: She was a preserver of knowledge, guarding the secrets of the ancient library.
meanings.sent5: The preserver of history, the museum, displayed artifacts from long ago.

meanings.definition: a substance used to preserve food
meanings.sent1: The preserver kept the fruits fresh for a long time.
meanings.sent2: I added a natural preserver to the jam to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: The preserver in the jar made the pickles taste delicious.
meanings.sent4: The preserver in the can prevented the food from spoiling.
meanings.sent5: The preserver on the label ensured the food stayed safe to eat.

meanings.definition: a life preserver worn for safety in water
meanings.sent1: The bright orange preserver kept the swimmer afloat in the pool.
meanings.sent2: Before going on the boat, he put on the life preserver for safety.
meanings.sent3: The preserver made the little girl feel like a superhero in the water.
meanings.sent4: The life preserver was like a guardian angel, protecting the sailor.
meanings.sent5: The life preserver was a lifesaver, ensuring the swimmer stayed above water.
